alert.note: Alert for Franklin; St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 2:55PM EDT until May 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, western Franklin and eastern St. Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parishville, Lake Ozonia, Carry Falls Reservoir, Lawrenceville, Dickinson, Hopkinton, Stark, Nicholville, Converse, Buckton, St. Regis Falls, South Colton and Dickinson Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
